outputs.name: points
outputs.description: Test points at the center of each mesh face.

outputs.name: vectors
outputs.description: Vectors for the normal direction at each of the points.

outputs.name: mesh
outputs.description: Analysis mesh that can be passed to the 'Color Mesh' component.

inputs.name: _geometry
inputs.description: Brep or Mesh from which to generate the points and grid.

inputs.name: _grid_size
inputs.description: Number for the size of the test grid.

inputs.name: _offset_dist_
inputs.description:
Number for the distance to move points from the surfaces
of the input _geometry.  Typically, this should be a small positive
number to ensure points are not blocked by the mesh. Default is 0.

code:
try:
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.togeometry import to_gridded_mesh3d, to_mesh3d
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.fromgeometry import from_mesh3d, from_point3d, from_vector3d
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.{{plugin}} import all_required_inputs
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_{{cad}}:\n\t{}'.format(e))


if all_required_inputs(ghenv.Component):
    # check the input and generate the mesh.
    _offset_dist_ = _offset_dist_ or 0
    try:  # assume it's a {{Cad}} Brep
        lb_mesh = to_gridded_mesh3d(_geometry, _grid_size, _offset_dist_)
    except TypeError:  # assume it's a {{Cad}} Mesh
        try:
            lb_mesh = to_mesh3d(_geometry)
        except TypeError:  # unidientified geometry type
            raise TypeError(
                '_geometry must be a Brep or a Mesh. Got {}.'.format(type(_geometry)))
    
    # generate the test points, vectors, and areas.
    points = [from_point3d(pt) for pt in lb_mesh.face_centroids]
    vectors = [from_vector3d(vec) for vec in lb_mesh.face_normals]
    face_areas = lb_mesh.face_areas
    mesh = from_mesh3d(lb_mesh)
